title: RealWorld â€“ A Collection of Exemplary Front End and Back End Codebases
author: ericmsimons
content: readme.md stay the bleeding edge join gitter room! how exact same medium.com clone (called conduit) is built using of supported frontends backends. yes, can mix match , because all adhere the same api spec while "todo" demos provide excellent cursory glance a framework's capabilities, typically don't convey knowledge & perspective required actually build real applications it.realworld solves by allowing to choose frontend (react, angular 2, & more) any backend (node, django, & more) see they power real world, beautifully designed fullstack app called "conduit".read full blog post announcing realworld medium.frontendssorted popularity every 24 hours.react / redux elm angular 4+ angular 1.5+ react / mobx in progress: ember | vue | react+relay | svelte | aurelia | clojurescript | mithril | vanilla js (web components)backendssorted popularity every 24 hours.node / express laravel django rails cakephp asp.net core kotlin / spring koa / knex qewd.js in progress: clojure | crystal + kemal | dotnet core (c#) | dropwizard | elixir + phoenix | f# | falcon + gae | firebase + gcp cloud | flask | + gin | + gorilla mux | + net/http | hapijs | haskell / servant | loopback 3.0 | nim | node + graphql | node (lambda + dynamodb) | phalcon | rust | scala + play | slim | spring (w/ spring boot) | symfonymobile in progress: react native | ionic 2+ | xamarincreate new stack any these frameworks ( one isn't listed)?create new framework implementation >>> you view upcoming stacks (wips)note: stacks are wip are experimental incomplete.don't expect everything work perfectly of box! do get & running?simply follow instructions the readme whatever frontend /or backend repo's want get and running. you teach how build each stack scratch?yup! 've built step--step tutorials all our stacks teach how go git init the to production ready application. start learning >>>community created resourcesforks, tutorials, workshops, other resources based the realworld project:react+redux / node testing workshop kent c. doddsexample repo showing react+redux node stacks working together w/ tddlive recording his workshop is available youtubelearn more"introducing realworld " eric simonsevery tutorial is built against same api spec ensure modularity every frontend & backendevery frontend utilizes same hand crafted bootstrap 4 theme identical ui/ux is hosted version the backend api available public usage, api keys requiredinterested creating new realworld stack? view starter guide & spec made ?realworld not possible without open source community continuously helping push project forward. addition, have core project team composed :eric simons - founder/leaderic is software engineer, ui designer, author many technical books & tutorials. oversees project direction, maintenance organizes planning development efforts the team.albert pai - founder/leadalbert is software engineer, devops ninja, author many technical books & tutorials. oversees project direction, maintenance organizes planning development efforts the team.thinkster - funding/supportthinkster creates high quality resources help javascript developers succeed. realworld project wouldn't exist without funding, please consider investing a pro subscription help support !james brewer - adminjames is software engineer square a contributor the django project. created & maintains rw django codebase continually provides guidance the realworld project itself.anish karandikar - adminmathworker, ex-google, ex-computational fluid dynamicist, forever lover tech & humanities sandeesh s. - adminfull stack developer, laravel enthusiast, digital marketing specialist an avid gamer.cameron chapman - admincameron chapman is software engineer argus health. 's open source enthusiast is helping teach local web development boot camp kansas university.special thanks ...realworld wouldn't possible without help the open source community reviewing codebases, creating app implementations, many tasks help push project forward. especially appreciate oss leaders have helped contribute realworld:dan abramov (creator redux) helping spark initial idea, getting redux community involved, well graciously taking time provide feedback the redux codebasemax lynch (creator ionic) taking time provide guidance the early days this projectaddy osmani (creator todomvc) helping spark initial idea his amazing with todomvctodomvc (team & contributors) their exemplary & successful ; their project & org has been invaluable analogy us we've built realworldjames brewer (docs contributor django) countless brainstorming sessions, helping name project, creating django codebase + tutoriallicense of codebases are mit licensed unless otherwise specified.
